Key Match Events: Italy won 3-1 against France at Parc des Princes
Pre-Game Insights: France cannot afford a sub-par showing in 2024-25 as the nation that finishes bottom of each group will automatically be relegated, while third-placed teams must take part in a playoff to avoid dropping down into League B.
Italy are rebuilding from a lower base and remain short of quality in key areas.
France have been hit by injuries, their well of talent is deep.

Didier Deschamps has kept faith with most of his Euro 2024 squad for this month's Nations League fixtures, but free agent Adrien Rabiot and Inter Milan defender Benjamin Pavard have both been dropped.
Luciano Spalletti's side never really found their rhythm, and few complaints could be made when they were sent packing by neighbours Switzerland in the last 16, abruptly ending their title defence.
Giacomo Raspadori and in-form Atalanta BC striker Mateo Retegui could start up front in a 3-5-2 formation.
Post-Match Reflections: Italy's win over France at Parc des Princes marked a strong start to their UEFA Nations League campaign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The top two in Group 2 - which also features Belgium and Israel - will qualify for a new quarter-final round, with the winners of those ties progressing to the finals in June of next year.
This was Italy's first competitive meeting with France in some 16 years.
Others: Italy's first competitive meeting with France in 16 years was marked by a 3-1 win for Italy.
